You might want to update your nvidia drivers. This doesn't seem to be the problem though, as your pc looks in good shape to run KSP.

Could you post the logs from the game? This are normally located at .steam/SteamApps/common/Kerbal...

Is the whole machine freezing or is it just your desktop environment ?

Check you system logs, usually in /var/log

My slackware system writes to /var/log/messages every twenty minutes, if your mint system does the same leave it running for half an hour next time it freezes then check the logs after a reboot.

It is definitely not the game.

The freezing is happening outside the game now so its not squads issue.

Im not getting any errors in the log.

Personally I find these lines from your log more than a little concerning. Are those temps & frequencies what it puts out under full load, or is that what it's idling at?

> 
> You might want to update your nvidia drivers.

I'd second that.

NVidia driver is version 346.47 now.

Also your cpu temperature looks high. I use a Shuttle SZ87R6 which is not known for high performance cooling and it idles at 30C, starting up KSP Interstellar barely gets it to 50 C.
My laptop gets up to 90C at full CPU and GPU load (with an undervolted CPU and an external fan), and is hasn't died after a few years, though I feel guilty every time I push it.
